availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Mr Bush as one we all demand you at the risk of your sons life to help that widow or his deth Is Sirtain so shure as you live in your case and splendor while her poor Boy her only Suport is sufer from your sones wrath and her toiling night and day to make a support for him now by god you must suport her famley untill he gets well or by god we will come tar and Fether the last damed one and set fier too you and your damed house by god send provishion and plenty of it and you ar not
to let no one naer it you ar to Send it by that damed Betersworth tell him to tell her you sent it to her and if you do your duty we will let you all alone Mrs Crane is in a great deal of Trouble about her sone and how she will get through the winter you had beter tend to her by god
